intro: Linaria remotiflora, commonly known as the distant-flowered toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers have a distinctive spurred shape, which is a key feature of the genus Linaria. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant color and delicate appearance.
